availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fredrick Fritz (Cincinnati, Ohio, butcher and Coffee House owner.)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, butcher and coffee house owner. Native of Germany. Married to Apolonia Wenstel Fritz in Hamilton County, Ohio, on July 20, 1864. Father of Maria Fritz, Louisa Fritz, Fred Fritz, and Josephine Fritz. Butcher in Cincinnati in 1850. Tavern Keeper in Cincinnati in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 11, p. 338B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 11, p. 146.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 19, p. 574B.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 000344476, p. 148.
"Fredrick “Fred” Fritz (1831-1893)," Find A Grave, Memorial 78934209, accessed August 2, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/78934209.
